website_summaries.verdict: GoPro continues to innovate with the first consumer-friendly camera that can film in 360 degrees. If you've ever wanted to make your own Virtual Reality videos, this is the camera to get.
pros: it's got multiple microphones on board for rich multi-channel audio
cons: It's missing some of the fun features found on other GoPro cameras, like live streaming or TimeWarp (their unique approach to creating time-lapse videos)

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: You will be disappointed with the video quality, and further frustrated by the GoPro software which in theory helps you import the file. This product is not ready for showtime!
customer_reviews.author: Reza K.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: May shoot 360 video but cant do anything with it afterwards. Software sucks! Wish I could return it for a refund!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to review any footage yet, but that's because this camera makes it nearly impossible. - It won't connect to my PIxel 3, a brand-new smartphone (it's not supported it) - It took about 2 hours to transfer a 1min video to my MBP with Fusion Studio - That video is about 6gb, and won't play anywhere (either in Fusion Studio or just a player) - It's asking I update the Fusion, says easiest way is with the app (which I can't use) Fairly brutal first setup. No way to review footage, no way to share with my phone or computer, no way to update. Zoinks.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Buggy stitching software renders great hardware useless.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware and image quality are fantastic. Required stitching software is as buggy as everyone says. I render on a desktop and rendering time is not a problem (10 min of footage takes ~6-7 min to cineform at full resolution). However the fusion software regularly crashes. Worse, the “recover project” option only results in more crashing. Therefore, user has to start project from scratch regularly. It is infuriating. The fusion desktop software is useless. Without the software, the hardware is useless. The camera came out 1.5 years ago. If they haven’t fixed the software yet, they probably never will.
customer_reviews.author: Monsterlib

customer_reviews.title: A Great 360 Camera with Some Usability Issues
customer_reviews.text: The GoPro Fusion is a great choice if you want to save some money but are looking for a robust 360 camera. Because GoPro has not released proper desktop software for the Max, the Fusion is actually a great choice if you plan to work with 5.2K footage. The need for dual memory cards and lots of post rendering make it less "consumer friendly" but pros will likely not blink. Great battery life and even the nice hard case and handle that come wih it make the GoPro Fusion a class act that's a steal at current selling prices.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Great 360 camera!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing 360 camera if you have the computer to render the files. It uses 2 different micro sd cards, one for the front cam and one for the back cam. You have to download “fusion studio” which is a barley stable program. Crashes 1/3 of the time you use it. Anyway you have to render the two files together with that program and depending on your computer, can take forever. The fusion is a great camera though. Awesome quality video, easy to use as any GoPro is. Water resistant and what not. Just can’t pop off quick edits, basically need a day to get the footage into an editable form. But for $200, it’s worth it.

customer_reviews.title: No 360 Camera Is Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The Fusion has its flaws - like any other brand - but for what it's worth I'm happy, happy enough to buy a second one. Shooting (and editing) in 360 is not only a learning curve, but introduces technical challenges in storage and rendering speed. The problems I see people run into can be experienced with any 360 camera. Overall I think the Fusion is in the top 3 for consumer level 360 cameras in the price range.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera to capture the best moments
customer_reviews.text: The GoPro Fusion has allowed me to capture every moment snowboarding, skydiving, riding my motorcycle, and more. With helmet mounts and other mounts I bought to attach to whatever I'm doing, I've been able to take this camera everywhere and not be afraid and baby it too much. Customer support has been amazing, when I would have an issue with the camera they put in the time to help me and replace problem parts. I highly recommend this camera to anyone that wants to capture a moment wherever they go, this camera can handle it.

customer_reviews.title: you have to be a computer genius to use

Takes hours to render any videos and they still look awful in the end. I have seen great footage with these cameras online but I could not get it to work even on a very nice expensive computer I borrowed. WOULD NOT recommend to anyone who is not confident in their ability to edit photos and videos using computer software

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deal IF you already have a FAST computer, definitely worth the pickup for $200

I'm running a 3.4 ghz 6-core processor with a gtx1050ti 4GB and am able to render 1 minute footage in about 2 minutes. The only way to get the maximum quality out of the fusion is rendering it in ProRes and editing in post using Adobe Premiere. If you render directly to social media quality will be very pixelated. Quality is amazing for what it is and for the $200 price tag this is a STEAL!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!!!

The basic features of the camera are so easy to use that my 7-year old niece uses it sufficiently, but it has advanced features for professionals who want more control of its functionality. Editing is separate from the actual product review, but it is very important when considering to buy this camera. If you have plans to use computer software, make sure that the computer meets the specifications required for rendering.
